journals.notes: This is strange. I have exactly the same system as you do with the same version of CMake (2.8.12.2) and cannot reproduce this error.

Radegast wrote:
> This is strange. I have exactly the same system as you do with the same version of CMake (2.8.12.2) and cannot reproduce this error.

hmm, any chance you can send me a build version, so i can at least play

I don't understand why the same cmake version can't parse our CMakeLists.txt: 
CMake Error: Error in cmake code at
/Users/absolly/etlegacy/CMakeLists.txt:1206:
Parse error.  Function missing ending ")".  End of file reached.
-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
- We should verify if cmake versions are identically. How is cmake installed? - Does the parse error also occure with previous cmake releases ( f.e. 2.6.4)? - Are there any significant differences in the platforms (f.e. locale, environment vars ...)?

> - Does the parse error also occure with previous cmake releases ( f.e. 2.6.4)?

Yea, you should completely remove your CMake.app and install it again. I think this must be because of broken CMake installation. Those warnings about missing whitespace are completely bogus. 

absolly wrote:
> hmm, any chance you can send me a build version, so i can at least play

We are just about to make a new release. There will be an OS X version as well. Check the front page in a week or so!

Radegast wrote:
> > - Does the parse error also occure with previous cmake releases ( f.e. 2.6.4)?
> 
> Yea, you should completely remove your CMake.app and install it again. I think this must be because of broken CMake installation. Those warnings about missing whitespace are completely bogus. 
> 
> absolly wrote:
> > hmm, any chance you can send me a build version, so i can at least play
> 
> We are just about to make a new release. There will be an OS X version as well. Check the front page in a week or so!
great thanks!
Have you tried the new CMake release 3.0.0?
I'll close this. There is no feedback given and the issue itself seems related to the local system of absolly - we can't reproduce. Just reopen if you disagree.

subject: cmake syntax error whitespace osx mavericks
description:
this error gets spammed when trying to comple the latest source

CMake Warning (dev) in CMakeLists.txt:
  Syntax Warning in cmake code at

    /Users/tiemen/etlegacy/CMakeLists.txt:803:24

  Argument not separated from preceding token by whitespace.
This warning is for project developers.  Use -Wno-dev to suppress it.

removing  OUTPUT_STRIP_TRAILING_WHITESPACE on line 187 does nothing
